org.xmlserializer4j

Class XMLSerializer

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.xmlserializer4j.XMLSerializer

  • public class XMLSerializer
extends java.lang.Object

    XML serializer class that encodes Java objects into XML representations.

    Author:
    Martin

    • Field Detail

      • DEFAULT_DOCUMENT_BUILDER

        public static final javax.xml.parsers.DocumentBuilder DEFAULT_DOCUMENT_BUILDER

      • HUMAN_READABLE_TRANSFORMER

        public static final javax.xml.transform.Transformer HUMAN_READABLE_TRANSFORMER

        Human readable transformer that performs indentation of output data. Set to 4 spaces per indent.

      • DEFAULT_TRANSFORMER

        public static final javax.xml.transform.Transformer DEFAULT_TRANSFORMER

        Default transformer.

      • INCLUDE_NULL_VALUES

        public static final org.xmlserializer4j.XMLSerializer.Setting INCLUDE_NULL_VALUES

        Serialize null values.

      • INCLUDE_PRIMITIVE_ZERO_FALSE

        public static final org.xmlserializer4j.XMLSerializer.Setting INCLUDE_PRIMITIVE_ZERO_FALSE

        Includes primitives 0 and false values. These are not strictly necessary for correct deserialization.

      • INCLUDE_PARENTCLASS_FIELDS

        public static final org.xmlserializer4j.XMLSerializer.Setting INCLUDE_PARENTCLASS_FIELDS

        Include parent class fields.

      • INCLUDE_STATIC

        public static final org.xmlserializer4j.XMLSerializer.Setting INCLUDE_STATIC

        Include static fields.

      • INCLUDE_STATIC_FINAL_PRIMITIVES

        public static final org.xmlserializer4j.XMLSerializer.Setting INCLUDE_STATIC_FINAL_PRIMITIVES

        Include static final primitive values.

      • INCLUDE_SCOPE_ALWAYS

        public static final org.xmlserializer4j.XMLSerializer.Setting INCLUDE_SCOPE_ALWAYS

        Always includes the scope attribute for resolving duplicate field names in parent classes.

      • EXCLUDE_ALL

        public static final org.xmlserializer4j.XMLSerializer.Setting EXCLUDE_ALL

        Excludes all fields by default unless an explicit XMLInclude annotation is present.

      • INCLUDE_HASHCODE

        public static final org.xmlserializer4j.XMLSerializer.Setting INCLUDE_HASHCODE

        Include object hash codes as attributes. Useful for debugging purposes.

      • setTransformer

        public void setTransformer(javax.xml.transform.Transformer transformer)

        Sets the transformer.

        Use HUMAN_READABLE_TRANSFORMER to generate human-readable XML files that include linebreaks and indentation.

        Parameters:
        transformer -

      • getSerializers

        public java.util.List<SerializerEntry> getSerializers()

        Returns the serializer list.

        The default settings use a LinkedList so adding your own SerializerEntry implementations can be easily done by using LinkedList.addFirst(Object).

        The first serializer in the list that is applicable for serializing a particular object is used and cached for reuse for that particular object class. Thusly the last serializer in the list is an instance of the DefaultSerializer by default.

        Note: When the list is altered after a serialization pass a call to clearCache() must be made in order to avoid the cache interfering with the updated configuration.

        Returns:

      • getSerializerByClass

        public TypeSerializer<?> getSerializerByClass(java.lang.Class<?> clazz)

        Returns the appropriate registered TypeSerializer for the given Class or null when none could be found.

        When a TypeSerializer implementation is found it is cached for that particular class. This enables a fast lookup the second time an object of the same class must be serialized.

        Parameters:
        clazz -
        Returns:

      • clearCache

        public void clearCache()

        Clears the serializer cache.

        This is only necessary when the cache is already populated and the serializer configuration has been altered.
